US AMOC International Science Meeting 2015 - Abstract submission open </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;299afd80.1501</link>   <description> Abstract submission is now open for the RAPID - US AMOC International Science Meeting 2015: &quot;Towards a holistic picture of the<br>Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation via observation modelling and synthesis.&quot;<br><br>The meeting will be held in Bristol. 21-24 July 2015, Bristol, U.K.<br><br>SCIENCE THEMES<br>1. Characterising the AMOC - structure, variability, mechanisms and ocean response<br>2. Impacts of the AMOC on the atmosphere, cryosphere, and land<br>3. AMOC state estimation, predictability and prediction<br>4. Novel approaches to pan-Atlantic observations, modelling, analysis and synthesis [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-21T13:47:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Byfield, Val</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;299afd80.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;4f66e6ef.1412">   <title>RAPID - US AMOC International Science Meeting, 21-24 July 2015, Bristol, U.K. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;4f66e6ef.1412</link>   <description> The RAPID - US AMOC International Science Meeting - Towards a holistic picture of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation via observation, modelling and synthesis - will take place in Bristol, UK on 21-25 July 2015.<br><br>This is the third in the series of science meetings jointly organised by the NERC RAPID programme and the US AMOC program. The goal of this meeting is a holistic understanding of the Atlantic meridional overturning circulation (AMOC) and its impacts on weather, climate and ecosystems, in the past, present and future. Hence the meeting will seek to address the following themes: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T11:03:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Byfield, Val</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;4f66e6ef.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;332a7786.1407">   <title>RAPID AMOC meeting in London 18-19 September 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;332a7786.1407</link>   <description> 10 years of observations of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation: results from RAPID, surprises and future plans. 18-19 September 2014, Church House, Westminster, London<br>In 2014 RAPID attained the major milestone of 10 years of continuous observations of the AMOC. To mark this milestone, a day-and-a-half meeting is being held in London, at Church House, on 18-19 September 2014. The joint UK-US RAPID programme has been making observation of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) since April 2004. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-03T10:13:46+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Byfield, Val</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=RAPID-GENERAL;332a7786.1407</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
